prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
Example:
Question:
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: My first client. Just standing in front of this guy makes me nervous...
Character 1
Name: Shadi Smith
Description: The victim in this case. A traveler, only recently back in-country.
Character 2
Name: Winston Payne
Description: The prosecuting attorney. For all his experience, he lacks a certain presence...
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Post-Mortem Report
Description: Death occurred a little after 2 p.m. and was caused by loss of blood from a gunshot to the chest. The bullet did not pass through the victim's body.
Evidence 1
Name: Photograph of Victim
Description: A photographic print that shows the victim. He was shot from the front in the chest and subsequently died.
Evidence 2:
Name: Crime Scene Photograph
Description: A bottle of carbonated water and a steak lunch can be seen on the victim's table.
Evidence 3:
Name: Medical Report Card
Description: A record of dental work. On the day of the murder, the victim had undergone dental treatment and been prohibited from eating or drinking anything but water.
Evidence 4:
Name: Photograph of Handbag
Description: A photograph taken by Hosonaga-san after the incident occurred. It shows Miss Brett's handbag on a chair by the victim's table.
Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I was ingesting a regulation beef steak at the restaurant while having a tactical discussion with the old man.
Person: Nosa
Testimony 1
Testimony 1: Myself, I was extolling the virtues of a particularly fine golden curio to the military gentleman.
Person: Korekuta
Testimony 2
Testimony 2: At that precise moment, a firearm was discharged! I observed the enemy's actions with my own eyes!
Person: Nosa
Testimony 3
Testimony 3: The black-uniformed varsity cadet fired on the English civilian! And from the back, the cowardly little weasel!
Person: Nosa
Testimony 4
Testimony 4: I was on my hands and knees, investigating the where-abouts of my mysteriously absconded precious curio.
Person: Korekuta

Answer:
Let's think step by step:
Let's analyze the evidence and testimonies provided.
Testimony 3 states that the gun shot was fired "from the back". However, Evidence 0, which is "Post-Mortem Report," states that the victim died "from a gunshot to the chest", which implies that the witness is lying.
{"evidence": 0, "testimony": 3}
Question:Characters:
Character 0
Name: Kay Faraday
Description: A self-styled Great Thief and so-called "second Yatagarasu" who's always looking to bag the greatest treasure of all -- the truth.
Character 1
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective from the local precinct who's always first on the scene at any murder investigation.
Character 2
Name: Bronco Knight
Description: A former bodyguard who killed his team leader. He is set to stand trial soon.
Character 3
Name: Eddie Fender
Description: A defense attorney I have known for a long time, but haven't seen in years. Apparently, he lived abroad for a while.
Character 4
Name: Rocco Carcerato
Description: An inmate and former boxer who is obsessed with training. Has a pet polar bear named Teddy.
Character 5
Name: Verity Gavèlle
Description: A district court judge and member of the Committee for Prosecutorial Excellence, who also acts as its mouthpiece.
Character 6
Name: Eustace Winner
Description: A rookie prosecutor who's taken over my cases on the Committee's orders.
Character 7
Name: Simeon Saint
Description: The suspect in this case. A timid young man who seems an unlikely murderer.
Character 8
Name: Fifi Laguarde
Description: Warden of the prison. An animal lover who considers physical contact to be very important.
Character 9
Name: Frank Sahwit
Description: The prison inmate who first discovered the body. Currently training to be a pet stylist.
Character 10
Name: Bodhidharma Kanis
Description: A blind ex-assassin whose favored tools were a black dog and a knife. The tinkling of small bells used to accompany his appearance.
Character 11
Name: Shi-Long Lang
Description: An Interpol agent with an unrivaled arrest rate. Originally from Zheng Fa.
Character 12
Name: Regina Berry
Description: Head animal trainer at the Berry Big Circus, and Saint's boss.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Prosecutor's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. However, I prefer to keep it in my pocket.
Evidence 1
Name: Building Layout
Description: A map of the facility, including the detention center and the prison proper.
Evidence 2
Name: Mr. Knight's Body
Description: Cause of death: Stab wound to the throat. Death would have been instant. There is also a small cut on his scalp from when he suffered a blow to the head. Killed instantly by a stab wound to the throat. The body is covered in dirt. There is also a small cut on his scalp from when he suffered a blow to the head. Killed instantly by a stab wound to the throat. There is also a small cut on his scalp from when he suffered a blow to the head. A sweet scent can be detected.
Evidence 3
Name: Pocket Chess Set
Description: A folding chessboard with the pieces stored inside. It appears to have belonged to the victim. A folding chessboard with the pieces stored inside. It belonged to Knight, and was brought to him at his request by Saint. Portable folding chessboard. Belonged to Knight. There is a hidden space inside the chessboard. Knight hid a chisel in here to prevent it from being found by the prison staff.
Evidence 4
Name: Rubber Glove
Description: Only one glove was found at the crime scene. Prison-issued equipment for working inmates. Stained with blood and mud. Found in Workshop A. Used by Sahwit when he was doing his animal styling training. Stained with blood and mud. Found in Workshop A. Sullied after being worn by Sahwit when administering a dark mudpack treatment. Also bloodstained.
Evidence 5
Name: Rope
Description: Discovered on top of Knight's body. Does this mean the victim was tied up?
Evidence 6
Name: Bloodstained Sheet
Description: Colorful tarp found by the victim's body. Some of these were being stored in Workshop A.
Evidence 7
Name: Door Sensors
Description: Fitted to each workshop's door, they detect and react to the prisoners' bracelets by raising the alarm. They open the doors if an animal is detected, but raise the alarm if an inmate's bracelet is detected. Prisoners are not allowed to move about freely.
Evidence 8
Name: Prison Roll Call
Description: Held three times a day: 7 AM, noon, and 9 PM. The victim's body had not been found at the time of the 7 AM roll call.
Evidence 9
Name: Black Dog
Description: Sahwit claims to have seen this dog biting the victim's throat. He doesn't seem to like me very much.
Evidence 10
Name: Sahwit's Bracelet
Description: Sahwit's bracelet is broken, and can no longer be detected by the prison's sensors. Sahwit's bracelet wasn't working at the time of the incident, and could not be detected by the sensors.
Evidence 11
Name: Dog Chess Piece
Description: Carved for fun by Kanis. He also seems to be engaged in correspondence chess via postal mail.
Evidence 12
Name: Prison Search
Description: Winner, Gavèlle and the warden searched the prison for the murder weapon, but couldn't find anything.
Evidence 13
Name: Wiped Floor
Description: There are signs that the floor in the victim's detention center cell was wiped clean. There are signs that the floor in the victim's cell was wiped clean. I've ordered a test to see if it was blood. There are signs that blood was wiped from the floor of the victim's cell. We're currently checking whose blood it is. There are signs that blood was wiped from the floor of the victim's cell. The blood has been confirmed as Knight's.
Evidence 14
Name: Chess Diagram
Description: The positions of the pieces match those on the board in Kanis's cell. Knight was playing correspondence chess against Kanis. Did the two have some sort of connection?
Evidence 15
Name: Security Camera Footage
Description: Footage of a detention center holding cell showing the victim being attacked by a dark form. The time stamp is off due to a three-hour gap in the footage. This was actually recorded around 9 AM.
Evidence 16
Name: Missing Guard Uniform
Description: Stolen from a guard's locker in the detention center corridor on March 26th.
Evidence 17
Name: Mr. Knight's Cell Key
Description: A guard was attacked and his keys, including the one to Knight's cell, were stolen. They have yet to be recovered. A guard was attacked the day before the murder, and his keys were stolen. They were found in Carcerato's possession.
Evidence 18
Name: Security Gates
Description: Deployed at the entrances to both the detention center and the prison proper. Capable of detecting items made of metal.
Evidence 19
Name: Tunnel Prints
Description: A photo of the tunnel between the prison and the detention center. It seems to depict the paw prints of a dog. A photo of the tunnel between the prison and the detention center. Shows paw prints made by a bear.
Evidence 20
Name: Autopsy Report
Description: The interim report suggests that the cause of death was a stab wound to the neck, inflicted by a sharp blade. Death was instantaneous. Estimated time of death is between 3 AM and 6 AM on the 27th. Instant death from a stab wound to the neck.
Evidence 21
Name: Chisel
Description: Contains traces of blood. Hidden by Kanis inside his dog's mouth. Has a small bell attached to it. Belonged to Knight. Hidden by Kanis in Helmut's mouth in order to avoid suspicion.
Evidence 22
Name: Mr. Kanis's Bells
Description: Only two such bells exist. One is attached to Helmut the dog, the other to Kanis's knife, which was seized by the police during his arrest.
Evidence 23
Name: Mr. Saint's Trick
Description: A contraption that used the well, a very heavy weight, three pulleys, and two lengths of rope to send Saint flying during the show. Used during the show to send Saint flying. The weights that drop into the well were replaced with the victim's body by someone.
Evidence 24
Name: Breakers
Description: Located in the power room, just off the prison yard. Were they tampered with the night before the body was found?

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: First of all, I would like you to explain my motive.
Person: Kanis
Testimony 1
Testimony: I do not know anyone by the name of Knightley. We share no connection.
Person: Kanis
Testimony 2
Testimony: So, I wouldn't think some motive for murder would just appear out of nowhere.
Person: Kanis
Testimony 3
Testimony: Or are you insinuating my Anubis had a motive?
Person: Kanis
Testimony 4
Testimony: Keh heh heh. He only bares his fangs at others on my command.
Person: Kanis

Answer:
Let's think step by step:
cot:
Let's analyze the evidence and testimonies for contradictions:

Evidence 2 (Mr. Knight's Body) states that the victim died from a stab wound to the throat and was covered in dirt.

Testimony 1 by Kanis states: "I do not know anyone by the name of Knightley. We share no connection." However, Evidence 3 (Pocket Chess Set) says the chess set belonged to Knight and was brought to him at his request by Saint, while Evidence 14 (Chess Diagram) states Knight was playing correspondence chess against Kanis, suggesting Kanis had a connection with Knight.

Therefore, Testimony 1 contradicts the evidence that links Kanis and Knight through the chess correspondence.

Answer:
Let's think step by step:
cot:
Let's analyze the evidence and testimonies carefully.

Evidence 15 (Security Camera Footage) states that footage of the detention center holding cell shows the victim being attacked by a dark form at around 9 AM, despite the time stamp being off.

Evidence 20 (Autopsy Report) states that the estimated time of death of Mr. Knight was between 3 AM and 6 AM on the 27th.

Here is the contradiction: The footage shows the victim being attacked at around 9 AM, but the autopsy report places the time of death much earlier between 3 and 6 AM, implying the victim could not have been attacked at the time shown on the footage.

Testimonies do not directly contradict this, but the question asks for one pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other.

Looking at the testimonies:

Testimony 1 (Gavèlle) states: "Since Mr. Elbird did not see the body when he passed through the tunnel..."

But Evidence 19 (Tunnel Prints) shows paw prints made by a bear and a dog in the tunnel, and might imply presence of animals, but it does not directly address visibility of the body.

Testimony 2: "It could only have been dropped down the well during the show." (Gavèlle)

Evidence 23: "Mr. Saint's Trick" describes that the weights dropping into the well were replaced with the victim's body by someone during the show.

This testimony is consistent with the evidence.

Testimony 3: "The only one who could have performed such an act is the suspect." (Gavèlle)

No direct evidence contradicts this.

Testimony 0: "I shared my reasoning with you the day before." (Gavèlle)

No direct evidence to contradict it.

So focusing back on the contradiction:

Evidence 15 shows a security camera footage recording the victim being attacked at 9 AM.

Evidence 20's autopsy report states the victim died between 3 AM and 6 AM, making the footage showing an attack at 9 AM inaccurate or fabricated.

So if we consider Testimony 1 (Gavèlle) stating that Mr. Elbird did not see the body when he passed through the tunnel (likely around or after 9 AM), this contradicts Evidence 15 in terms of timeline since the victim's body appears in the footage at 9 AM but supposedly not seen by Mr. Elbird.

But the strongest direct contradiction is between Evidence 15 (footage) and Evidence 20 (autopsy report), but the question strictly asks for one pair of evidence and testimony.

Alternatively, Witness Sahwit (Testimony not provided here) claims to have seen the black dog biting the victim’s throat (Evidence 9), while there is a glove found with blood and mud on it (Evidence 4), but no explicit testimony contradicts an evidence here.

Alternatively, Testimony 1 says "Mr. Elbird did not see the body when he passed the tunnel", but if the body was there during the footage time at 9 AM, this is a contradiction.

Therefore, a evident pair is:

Evidence 15 (Security Camera Footage showing the victim being attacked around 9 AM)

Testimony 1 (Gavèlle) stating that Mr. Elbird did not see the body when passing through the tunnel.

These contradict each other because the footage implies the body was present at 9 AM, but the testimony claims that Mr. Elbird didn't see it at that time.

Person: Laguarde

Person: Laguarde
Testimony 6

Person: Laguarde

Answer:
Let's think step by step:
cot:
Let's analyze the evidence and testimonies carefully.

Evidence 2 states that Mr. Knight's body had a stab wound to the throat and there was also a small cut on his scalp from a blow. The body was covered in dirt and a sweet scent could be detected.

Testimony 6 by Laguarde states: "He probably had a dog dispose of the body. This is the truth of the case."

Evidence 19, the Tunnel Prints, show paw prints possibly made by a bear, which contradicts Testimony 6's statement that a dog disposed of the body. If a dog had disposed of the body, we would expect dog paw prints, not bear prints.

Thus, there is a contradiction between Testimony 6 and Evidence 19.

prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
Example:
Question:
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: My first client. Just standing in front of this guy makes me nervous...
Character 1
Name: Shadi Smith
Description: The victim in this case. A traveler, only recently back in-country.
Character 2
Name: Winston Payne
Description: The prosecuting attorney. For all his experience, he lacks a certain presence...
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Post-Mortem Report
Description: Death occurred a little after 2 p.m. and was caused by loss of blood from a gunshot to the chest. The bullet did not pass through the victim's body.
Evidence 1
Name: Photograph of Victim
Description: A photographic print that shows the victim. He was shot from the front in the chest and subsequently died.
Evidence 2:
Name: Crime Scene Photograph
Description: A bottle of carbonated water and a steak lunch can be seen on the victim's table.
Evidence 3:
Name: Medical Report Card
Description: A record of dental work. On the day of the murder, the victim had undergone dental treatment and been prohibited from eating or drinking anything but water.
Evidence 4:
Name: Photograph of Handbag
Description: A photograph taken by Hosonaga-san after the incident occurred. It shows Miss Brett's handbag on a chair by the victim's table.
Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I was ingesting a regulation beef steak at the restaurant while having a tactical discussion with the old man.
Person: Nosa
Testimony 1
Testimony 1: Myself, I was extolling the virtues of a particularly fine golden curio to the military gentleman.
Person: Korekuta
Testimony 2
Testimony 2: At that precise moment, a firearm was discharged! I observed the enemy's actions with my own eyes!
Person: Nosa
Testimony 3
Testimony 3: The black-uniformed varsity cadet fired on the English civilian! And from the back, the cowardly little weasel!
Person: Nosa
Testimony 4
Testimony 4: I was on my hands and knees, investigating the where-abouts of my mysteriously absconded precious curio.
Person: Korekuta

Answer:
Let's think step by step:
Let's analyze the evidence and testimonies provided.
Testimony 3 states that the gun shot was fired "from the back". However, Evidence 0, which is "Post-Mortem Report," states that the victim died "from a gunshot to the chest", which implies that the witness is lying.
{"evidence": 0, "testimony": 3}

Answer:
Let's think step by step:
cot:
Let's analyze key pieces of evidence and testimonies for contradictions.

Evidence 20 (Autopsy Report) states the time of death was between 3 AM and 6 AM on the 27th, caused by a stab wound to the neck.

Testimony 1 states: "Around 3 AM the day before the show, the victim was brought into my office." This places the victim alive around 3 AM on the day before the show.

Testimony 4 states: "After our talk, he went right back to his cell, I assure you." This suggests the victim was alive after 3 AM and went directly back to his cell.

We need to check if these testimonies contradict the time of death in Evidence 20.

If the victim was alive at 3 AM and went back to his cell right after, but died between 3 AM and 6 AM, this could be possible. However, considering the timeline, if the victim was alive at 3 AM exactly, then the death sometime between 3 AM and 6 AM is still possible, but if the testimony implies after 3 AM the victim was back in the cell, probably alive, then the exact time of death closer to 3:00 AM is questionable.

More importantly, Evidence 8 (Prison Roll Call) says the body was not found at 7 AM roll call, implying the body was discovered after 7 AM.

No clear contradiction there.

Now, look at Evidence 9 (Black Dog): Sahwit claims to have seen a black dog biting the victim's throat.

Testimony 5 (Laguarde states): "Kanis was the one I hated. And he had no connection with the victim."

If Kanis is the owner of the black dog, then Sahwit's account implicates Kanis, which Laguarde contradicts.

However, this is not a direct contradiction between testimony and evidence.

Looking for contradictions with testimonies by Laguarde, who says the victim was brought to her office around 3 AM and went straight back to his cell.

Look at Evidence 15 (Security Camera Footage) that shows a time gap around 9 AM, and footage shows the victim being attacked then.

This conflicts with Evidence 20 indicating time of death between 3 and 6 AM.

So security footage shows attack around 9 AM, but autopsy says death was between 3 and 6 AM.

Therefore, Evidence 15 (Security Camera Footage) contradicts Evidence 20 (Autopsy Report) on time of death.

But question asks for one pair of evidence and testimony that contradict.

Is there a testimony about the time of death from witnesses?

No explicit testimony on time of death.

Therefore, let's compare testimonies with this evidence.

Testimony 1 says victim was with Laguarde at 3 AM.

But if death happened between 3 and 6 AM, it is possible Laguarde saw the victim at 3 AM and victim died shortly after.

No real contradiction there.

Testimony 5 by Laguarde denies Kanis's connection with the victim.

Evidence shows Kanis hiding the chisel (Evidence 21) in his dog’s mouth, tying him to the murder weapon.

Thus, testimony 5 contradicts evidence 21.

Therefore, the strongest contradiction between evidence and testimony is:

Evidence 21: Chisel with blood found hidden by Kanis.

Testimony 5: Laguarde claims Kanis had no connection with the victim.

Hence, evidence 21 contradicts testimony 5.
